skills.name: commit
skills.description: Generate professional Git commit messages following conventional commit standards
skills.instructions:
When the user asks to commit changes, analyze the git diff and staged changes, then generate a clear, concise commit message following these rules:
1. Use conventional commit format: type(scope): subject
2. Types: feat, fix, docs, style, refactor, test, chore
3. Keep subject under 72 characters
4. Include detailed body if changes are complex
5. List breaking changes if any
6. Add Co-Authored-By: Claude Sonnet 4.5 <noreply@anthropic.com>

For this project:
- Use Chinese for A-share related features (A股晨报、市场数据等)
- Use English for technical changes (API, refactoring, etc.)
- Mention specific services if modified (e.g., us_stocks.py, generator.py)

skills.name: test
skills.description: Run tests for Python FastAPI backend and verify functionality
skills.instructions:
When the user asks to run tests:
1. Identify test files matching the pattern test_*.py
2. Run pytest with appropriate flags:
   - pytest -v for verbose output
   - pytest --cov=api for coverage report
   - pytest -k <keyword> for specific tests
3. For this project, focus on:
   - API endpoint tests (main.py routes)
   - Data source tests (akshare, yfinance)
   - Service layer tests (services/*.py)
   - Cache mechanism tests
4. Analyze failures and suggest fixes
5. Report coverage statistics

skills.name: review-pr
skills.description: Perform automated code review on pull requests
skills.instructions:
When the user asks to review a PR:
1. Fetch PR details using gh CLI: gh pr view <number>
2. Analyze changes focusing on:
   - API endpoint modifications (breaking changes?)
   - Data source logic (error handling?)
   - Cache invalidation correctness
   - Azure OpenAI usage (cost implications?)
   - Security issues (API keys, credentials)
3. Check for:
   - Missing tests for new features
   - Outdated documentation
   - Performance regressions
4. Provide actionable feedback with code suggestions
5. Highlight critical issues vs nice-to-haves

skills.name: fastapi-helper
skills.description: Assist with FastAPI development best practices
skills.instructions:
When working with FastAPI code:
1. Follow FastAPI best practices:
   - Use Pydantic models for request/response validation
   - Implement proper dependency injection
   - Add OpenAPI documentation (summary, description, tags)
   - Use async/await for I/O operations
2. For this project:
   - Maintain consistent error responses (HTTPException)
   - Add proper CORS configuration
   - Implement request/response logging
   - Use APIRouter for modularity
3. When creating new endpoints:
   - Add to appropriate router
   - Include comprehensive docstrings
   - Add example responses
   - Consider rate limiting for expensive operations
4. Security checklist:
   - Validate all inputs
   - Sanitize user data
   - Check authentication/authorization
   - Don't expose sensitive info in errors

skills.name: react-helper
skills.description: Assist with React 18 development and best practices
skills.instructions:
When working with React components:
1. Follow React 18 best practices:
   - Use functional components with hooks
   - Implement proper error boundaries
   - Optimize re-renders (useMemo, useCallback)
   - Follow component composition patterns
2. For this project (Vite + React):
   - Keep components in web/src/components/
   - Use Lucide React for icons (already installed)
   - Maintain consistent styling approach
   - Handle loading and error states
3. When creating components:
   - Props validation with PropTypes or TypeScript
   - Meaningful component and prop names
   - Extract reusable logic to custom hooks
   - Keep components focused (single responsibility)
4. Data fetching:
   - Use existing dataCache.js service
   - Implement proper loading states
   - Handle errors gracefully
   - Consider implementing SWR pattern
5. Performance:
   - Lazy load heavy components
   - Virtualize long lists
   - Optimize bundle size (code splitting)
